Please update our Docker image with the latest version of NodeJS. The current version is causing some compatibility issues that are affecting our application's performance. Additionally, make sure to enable automatic updates so we can stay on top of any future security patches.

Here are the debugging steps to fix the issues with your local repository:

1. Open terminal and navigate to your local repository folder.
2. Run 'git checkout -b feature/fix-aws-connectivity' to create a new branch and switch to it for making changes.
3. Edit the setup.py file according to the TODO comments provided by the previous developer. Make sure you follow all instructions carefully.
4. Save your changes and run 'git add .' to stage your modifications.
5. Commit the changes with 'git commit -m "Fix AWS connectivity issues"'.
6. Push the changes to the remote repository using 'git push origin feature/fix-aws-connectivity'.
7. Create a Pull Request (PR) by navigating to the repository in Github and clicking on the 'New Pull Request' button.
8. Fill out the PR details, providing a brief description of your fixes and any relevant information for reviewers.
9. Submit the PR and wait for the code review process to begin.
10. Once the changes are approved and merged into the main branch, run 'git checkout master' followed by 'git pull' to update your local repository with the latest codebase.
